channel.title: Bloomberg Technology

item.title: Rivian CEO Scaringe on China Tensions, Spin Off of Micromobility Business
item.description: Rivian CEO RJ Scaringe discusses the impact of the Trump administration's tariffs on the electric-vehicle industry and Rivian's spinoff of its micromobility business Also at the Bloomberg Tech Summit in San Francisco. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Elon Musk and President Trump Feud Impacts Tesla, SpaceX | Bloomberg Technology 6/5/2025
item.description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss the fallout between President Trump and Elon Musk, as Tesla stocks regain some of Thursday’s losses. Plus, the spat could impact U.S. space ambitions and SpaceX. The CEO of Anysphere, maker of AI coding assistant Cursor, also explains plans for its latest funding round. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Tesla Shares Caught in the Middle of Musk-Trump Breakup
item.description: When President Donald Trump won the election in November, investors viewed Tesla Inc. as one of the biggest winners. That bet now seems to be on shaky ground after investors watched the once formidable alliance dissolve in real time.
item.dc:creator: Joel Leon

media:content.media:description: Tesla vehicles at the company's store in Colma, California.

item.title: Trump Signs Order to Boost Drone Security Before World Cup
item.description: President Donald Trump signed executive orders Friday to bolster US drone capabilities, including strengthening counter-drone tools ahead of major sporting events such as the 2026 FIFA World Cup and the 2028 Summer Olympics that will be hosted in the country.
item.dc:creator: Allyson Versprille, Hadriana Lowenkron

media:content.media:description: A drone flies over a neighborhood in Houston, Texas.

item.title: Harvard Gets Other Universities’ Backing in Trump Funding Fight
item.description: A group of 18 leading US research universities, including Princeton, MIT, Caltech and Johns Hopkins, asked a federal judge for permission to file legal arguments in support of Harvard University in its high-stakes showdown with the Trump administration over more than $2 billion in frozen grant money.
item.dc:creator: Bob Van Voris

media:content.media:description: Harvard University merchandise at a bookstore near the Harvard University campus in Cambridge, Massachusetts, US, on Thursday, May 29, 2025. President Donald Trump said Harvard University should cap foreign student enrollment at 15%, ratcheting up his effort to force policy changes at the elite institution. Photographer: Mel Musto/Bloomberg

item.title: Perplexity, Google Bet Web Browsers Are a New Frontier for AI
item.description: Tech companies are rethinking web browsers for the AI era. But first…
item.dc:creator: Shirin Ghaffary

media:content.media:description: The Perplexity app in the Apple App Store on a smartphone arranged in Washington, DC, US, on Sunday, June 1, 2025. Samsung Electronics Co. is nearing a wide-ranging deal to invest in Perplexity AI Inc. and put search technology from the artificial intelligence startup at the forefront of the South Korean company’s devices.

item.title: Musk’s X Selects Polymarket as Prediction Market Partner
item.description: Elon Musk’s X and the cryptocurrency-based predictions market platform Polymarket are partnering to provide data-drive insights and recommendations derived from posts on the social media site to the predictions platform.
item.dc:creator: Kirk Ogunrinde

item.title: Commerce Sets New Rules for $43 Billion Broadband Plan
item.description: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick released new guidance aimed at reshaping a massive internet infrastructure program to connect the entire country with broadband service, ordering states to rework their initial coverage plans to deliver service at the lowest-possible price.
item.dc:creator: Kelcee Griffis

media:content.media:description: Howard Lutnick, US commerce secretary

item.title: Switch 2 Arrives to Strong Early Impressions
item.description: Nintendo’s first new gaming console in eight years is so far leaving fans and pundits with positive reactions
item.dc:creator: Jason Schreier

media:content.media:description: Customers at the sales launch of the Nintendo Switch 2 gaming console at the Currys Plc store on Oxford Street in London, UK, on Wednesday, June 4, 2025.

item.title: Telefonica, Masorange Said to Hold Early Talks on Vodafone Spain
item.description: Telefonica SA and Masorange have held informal talks on a potential deal for Vodafone Spain, people familiar with the matter said, a move that could lead to further consolidation in the country’s telecom market.
item.dc:creator: Clara Hernanz Lizarraga, Vinicy Chan

media:content.media:description: A Vodafone store in Barcelona, Spain.

item.title: Violent Extremists Post Anti-LGBTQ+ Bile in Response to Offline Events
item.dc:creator: Jeff Stone

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump displayed on the jumbotron during the 60th presidential inauguration parade at Capital One Arena in Washington, DC, US, on Monday, Jan. 20, 2025. President Donald Trump launched his second term with a strident inaugural address that vowed to prioritize America's interests with a "golden age" for the country, while taking on "a radical and corrupt establishment." Photographer: Kent Nishimura/Bloomberg

item.title: Deutsche Bank Explores Stablecoins and Tokenized Deposits
item.description: Deutsche Bank AG is examining stablecoins and different forms of tokenized deposits, as large financial institutions grow more confident expanding in the digital-asset sector.
item.dc:creator: Arno Schuetze, Anna Irrera

media:content.media:description: The headquarters of Deutsche Bank in Frankfurt.

item.title: Power CEO Says US to Lose AI Race to China Without New Lines
item.description: The question of whether or not the US wins the race with China to develop artificial intelligence will hinge on Washington backing the construction of power superhighways to move large quantities of electricity, according to one of the country’s biggest energy developers.
item.dc:creator: Naureen S Malik, Mark Chediak

media:content.media:description: Co-founder and CEO of Invenergy LLC Michael Polsky

item.title: Broadcom Falls After Lukewarm Forecast Disappoints AI Bulls
item.description: Shares of Broadcom Inc., a chip supplier to companies like Alphabet Inc. and Apple Inc., fell after the company gave a lackluster revenue forecast for the current quarter, suggesting that the AI spending frenzy isn’t as strong as some investors anticipated.
item.dc:creator: Dina Bass

media:content.media:description: The Broadcom Inc. headquarters in San Jose, California, US, on Monday, June 2, 2025. Broadcom Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on June 5.

item.title: Indonesia’s Sovereign Fund Weighs Role in Grab-GoTo Deal
item.description: Indonesia’s sovereign wealth fund Danantara is considering a role in Grab Holdings Ltd.’s planned $7 billion acquisition of GoTo Group, potentially allowing the country’s government to own a slice of an Asian internet powerhouse.
item.dc:creator: Olivia Poh, Elffie Chew, Manuel Baigorri

media:content.media:description: A Gojek driver in Jakarta. Photographer: Dimas Ardian/Bloomberg

item.title: Everything Apple Plans to Show at Its iOS 26-Focused WWDC 2025 Event
item.description: Company set to highlight software redesigns as it remains on sidelines of AI revolution.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: Apple’s previous WWDC event last June.

item.title: BYD’s Misfire With Price Cuts Sparks $20 Billion Stock Selloff
item.description: A renewed EV price war launched by BYD Co. has shaved more than $20 billion off its market value in just two weeks, as skepticism over the top Chinese automaker’s strategy takes some steam out of its big rally.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Yang

item.title: Dronemaker Destinus Seek Funds at Unicorn Valuation
item.description: Destinus, a drone company founded by a former Russian national that supplies weapons to Ukraine, is in talks to raise funds that would value the firm at as much as €1.5 billion ($1.7 billion), according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Kirchfeld, Yazhou Sun, Eyk Henning

media:content.media:description: A hornet drone manufactured by Destinus at the International Defence and Security Fair in Madrid, on May 12.

item.title: Lakestar Seeks to Raise a $300 Million European Defense Fund
item.description: Lakestar, a European venture capital firm that backed Spotify and Revolut, is pitching investors on a new fund dedicated to defense technologies, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Christina Kyriasoglou, Mark Bergen

media:content.media:description: Klaus Hommels, founder and chairman of Lakestar.

item.title: Starlink Gets India License to Start Services, Official Says
item.description: Elon Musk’s Starlink Inc. has got regulatory approval in India, paving the way for rolling out its satellite internet services in the world’s most-populous country.
item.dc:creator: Santosh Kumar, Shwetha Sunil

media:content.media:description: A Starlink Inc satellite-internet communication system antenna on the roof of a home in Accra, Ghana.

item.title: Uber CEO Makes Moves to Entice Customers to Use All His Services
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Natalie Lung looks at the strategy Uber Chief Executive Officer Dara Khosrowshahi described as the next steps for his company’s growth during an appearance at the Bloomberg Tech conference.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Lung

media:content.media:description: Dara Khosrowshahi, chief executive officer of Uber Technologies Inc., during the Bloomberg Tech conference in San Francisco, California, US, on Thursday, June 5, 2025. The event brings together leaders across tech and business to discuss how executives, entrepreneurs and investors can navigate the hazards and multiply the opportunities in today’s landscape.

item.title: The SEC Pinned Its Hack on a Few Hapless Day Traders. The Full Story Is Far More Troubling
item.description: When a notorious gang of Ukrainian cybercriminals hit a crucial database, the regulator quickly downplayed the breach. One of the hackers says the system is still a soft target.
item.dc:creator: Liam Vaughan

item.title: Bond Traders Consult Risk Bosses Daily to Prep for Next Storm
item.description: The turmoil that hit markets after Donald Trump’s Liberation Day tariffs may have faded, but the aftershocks roll on in the risk departments of some of the world’s biggest banks.
item.dc:creator: Alice Atkins

item.title: Hong Kong’s Platform for $166 Billion Pension Faces Glitches
item.description: Some Hong Kong pensioners migrating to a new electronic system for retirement savings have experienced glitches, raising concerns over the platform’s reliability as it enters a key phase of adding more users.
item.dc:creator: Shawna Kwan, Lulu Yilun Chen, Echo Wong

media:content.media:description: Hong Kong. Photographer: Peter Parks/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: HSBC’s Private Bank Turns Overweight US Stocks on AI Hopes
item.description: HSBC’s private banking arm has gone overweight US stocks and neutral on those in Europe, flipping its view from earlier this year after a breezy round of earnings from US tech companies.
item.dc:creator: Joanne Wong

media:content.media:description: Signage outside the HSBC Holdings Plc headquarters building in Hong Kong. Photographer: Chan Long Hei/Bloomberg

item.title: London’s Fintech Woes Spread as Wise Shifts Main Listing to US
item.description: Wise Plc just fired the latest warning shot for British bankers and lawmakers trying to get more IPO prospects to choose London — particularly in the fintech sector.
item.dc:creator: Aisha S Gani

media:content.media:description: Taavet Hinrikus

item.title: N26 Eyes New Round to Offer Partial Exit for Coatue, Third Point
item.description: German digital bank N26 is considering a new funding round at a reduced valuation that could allow some of its existing investors including Coatue Management, Third Point and Dragoneer Investment Group to recoup part of their investment, people familiar with the matter said.
item.dc:creator: Eyk Henning, Arno Schuetze, Crystal Tse

media:content.media:description: German internet bank N26 advertisement in Berlin, Germany, in 2021.

item.title: HelloFresh Executives Face Growing Dissent Over Pay Ahead of AGM
item.description: HelloFresh SE’s management could be edging closer to a revolt on executive pay after failing to heed investors’ warnings for the last three years.
item.dc:creator: Maggie Shiltagh

media:content.media:description: A HelloFresh mealkit.

item.title: Kuaishou’s Shares Climb After Outlining Video AI Revenue Jump
item.description: Kuaishou Technology’s stock climbed to its highest level since March after the social video service said it expected annual revenue from video-generation platform Kling AI to hit $100 million by February.
item.dc:creator: Vlad Savov, Zheping Huang

media:content.media:description: The Kuaishou Technology website. Bloomberg

item.title: Stonepeak Is Said in Exclusive Talks for Buyout of $2.1 Billion Yinson
item.description: Stonepeak Partners is in exclusive talks for a buyout of Yinson Holdings Bhd. that may value the firm at as much as 9 billion ringgit ($2.1 billion), according to people with knowledge of the matter, in what could be one of the biggest deals in Malaysia this year.
item.dc:creator: Elffie Chew

media:content.media:description: The Tun Razak Exchange (TRX) financial district in Kuala Lumpur, left, and other buildings in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia on Sunday, Jan. 14. 2024. Malaysia is scheduled to release it's annual gross domestic product (GDP) figures on Jan. 19. Photographer: Richard Humphries/Bloomberg
